banner_desc: Cboard is an open-source app for children and adults with speech and language impairments, aiding communication with symbols and text-to-speech.
feature_desc1: Cboard works on modern browsers and is available on a wide variety of platforms, including desktops, tablets and mobile phones. Offline support is available on Google Chrome (desktop & android).
feature_desc2: We use last technology trends to design and develop Cboard. Our ultimate goal is to offer a beautiful and intuitive interface that can be navigated without reading the user help.
feature_desc3: Check out what you can do with Cboard in the open!
feature_video: For Mobile Apps - automate mobile ads
showcase_title: Open Source, +45 languages, Modern UI, Crossplatform
faq_subtitle: Have a question? Check out our frequently asked questions to find your answer.

footer_text: What are you waiting for? Download Now!
locations_desc: We are a global company with collaborators worldwide. Our headquarters are located in the United States. We believe in a connected world through the technology. Our collaborators are from Argentina, Israel, Luxembourg, Spain, and Brazil.
author: author

faqs.answer1: Cboard is a free web application for children and adults with speech and language impairments, facilitating communication with pictures and text-to-speech.
faqs.faq2: Can I register myself using my social media accounts?
faqs.answer2: Yes! On the login page, you will be given the option to sign up with your Google, Apple, or Facebook account if you wish to do so. You can also register with an e-mail address.
faqs.faq3: What is the difference between a registered and a non-registered user?
faqs.answer3: A registered user is able to personalize their boards, and the changes made will be saved to their account so that when they log back in, they can use their customized boards. A non-registered user won‚Äôt be able to save changes safely. We recommend registering just in case, so your changes are guaranteed to be saved.
faqs.faq4: Which languages are supported by Cboard?
faqs.answer4: Cboard comes with support for 46 languages. To select a different language go to SETTINGS ‚Äì select LANGUAGE and those available will appear. Make a choice and a ‚Äòtick‚Äô will appear beside the language.
faqs.faq5: How do I print my board set in Cboard?
faqs.answer5: To print your board, press the printer logo on the left hand side of the black HOME bar, after having unlocked the HOME page. An Adobe Portable Document (.pdf) will be downloaded to your technology.

testimonials.text1: I love that your app has a free dark mode. Others I have tried using for my autistic partner said we would have to pay to have dark mode, and they are photo-sensitive. Thank you for not exploiting the disabled!.
testimonials.text2: I think this app is great! I tried to find other AAC apps, and there was not many like this one. In most AAC apps, they do not support typing. Also, they don't have an option to use children's voices. Good job for making a unique AAC app that works perfectly, at least for me!.
testimonials.text3: Great for adults with HFA who sometimes have non-verbal episodes, lose their voice briefly because of allergies or a sore throat, and to explain important things in pictures. I also love that you can type alongside the pictures. This app is fun and very easy to use, and is a real lifesaver in a medical situation.
testimonials.text4: It makes several necessary arrangements to be able to adapt to the model you want. I really liked the smart touch and settings. It's still free, with voice and constantly updated.
testimonials.text5: Very useful for a free aac app. The icon library is extensive and its very easy to edit! It can be a bit slow especially when editing but its upside is the typing option which Im looking for in other applications like Symbotalk or Letmetalk.
testimonials.text6: DOWNLOAD IT NOW!!! I have gone through so many app trying to find the right one for my disabled chiLd and this is IT!!!!! I can lock the screen, upload my own images, and even use my own voice?!? YES YES YES!!
testimonials.text7: Fantastic app. It has every feature you would need for a robust aac system with voicing, customization, and a wide selection of symbols.
testimonials.text8: I love this application. it's quite easy. and very useful to children and young adults with disabilities. I need this communication device because I have moderate to severe autism and I'm dating a girl named Chandler and she knows that I have four disabilities. I'm nonverbal.
testimonials.text9: Clear layout and user friendly, perfect for partially or nonverbal episodes.

team.text1: Mart√≠n Bedouret is an Electronic Engineer and works as a software developer and school teacher in C√≥rdoba, Argentina. After being diagnosed with ALS in 2016, he began working on creating Cboard to provide a free and accessible AAC app for children and adults with speech and language impairments.
team.text2: Katrina Cohen Cosentino has a degree in Sociology, and began working with Cboard in 2018 running user testing at different rehabilitation centers. She has experience in education project development and implementation.
team.text3: Tomi is a software enthusiast and a great surfer üèÑ. He enjoys to develop Assistive Technology to help people with disabilities. Tomi joined Cboard in 2021 and he has helped to improved the product and supported our open-source community.
team.text4: Rodri loves to develop great software for Cboard. He has a degree in computer science and loves the waves for surfing üèÑ. Rodri has contributed with great ideas to Cboard since he joined the team in 2021. As a good programmer, he always focus on quality and excellence, so his contribution is amazing.
team.text5: H√©ctor is a brilliant biomedical engineer and a very focused specialist in artificial intelligence. He has a lot of experience working with Assistive Technology and augmentative and alternative communication as a founder of his own company back in 2016.
team.text7: Shay is a Software developer from Israel. Started coding in 2012. Open-Source enthusiast. Co-founded Cboard with Martin Bedouret in 2017 with the intention of providing a free and open-source communication tool for adults and children with disabilities.
team.text8: Cosmo is much more than a dog, he is a friend and a great companion. He is always there to support the team and make us smile. Cosmo is a rescue dog for Martin and he loves to listen hard rock,play with his toys and go for walks.

timeline.text1: Shay Cojocaru created the repository on GitHub and started to look for collaborators.
timeline.text2: Cboard received an investment from the Unicef Innovation Fund to improve the app and make it more accessible.
timeline.text3: Cboard was launched to the public and received a lot of positive feedback from users.
timeline.text4: Cboard was used in European pilots to test the app in different languages and environments.
timeline.text5: The team expanded to include more developers and designers to improve the app.
timeline.text6: Cboard received a grant from Microsoft AI for Accessibility to improve the app with AI features.
timeline.text7: Cboard was updated with new AI features to improve the user experience.
timeline.text8: Cboard launched new products to help more people with disabilities communicate.

voice_cloning_subtitle: Apply for ElevenLabs Voice Cloning Access
voice_cloning_email_helper: We will send your ElevenLabs code to this address
voice_cloning_alt_contact_desc: If you would like to provide details for Speech and Language Therapist, Family Member or Support Person
voice_cloning_forms_desc: ElevenLabs requires a note from your Clinician that you have been diagnosed with a speech impairment. Please upload that note here. (Please keep the note as you may need to upload it again when you create your voice.)
partnership_subtitle: Bringing AI-powered voice cloning technology to individuals with speech impairments
partnership_quote: We're excited to announce our groundbreaking partnership with ElevenLabs to provide free voice cloning services for individuals with speech impairments. This collaboration represents a significant step forward in assistive technology and digital accessibility.
partnership_about_desc1: Cboard, the leading open-source communication aid platform, has joined forces with ElevenLabs, a pioneer in AI voice technology, to make advanced voice cloning accessible to those who need it most. This partnership aims to break down communication barriers and provide individuals with speech impairments the opportunity to preserve or create their unique voice identity.
partnership_about_desc2: Through this collaboration, eligible users will have access to ElevenLabs' cutting-edge voice synthesis technology at no cost, enabling them to generate natural-sounding speech that can be integrated with Cboard's communication platform.
partnership_benefit1: Free access to professional voice cloning technology
partnership_benefit2: Personalized voice creation for individuals with speech impairments
partnership_benefit3: Seamless integration with Cboard's communication platform
partnership_benefit6: Preservation of voice identity for progressive conditions
partnership_howworks_desc1: The process has been designed to be simple and accessible. Users can apply for free voice cloning services through our dedicated application form. Once approved, they'll work with our team to create a personalized voice model using ElevenLabs' advanced AI technology.
partnership_howworks_desc2: The resulting voice can then be integrated into Cboard's communication boards, allowing users to express themselves with a voice that truly represents their identity and personality.
partnership_eligibility_desc1: This program is available to individuals with documented speech impairments who would benefit from voice cloning technology. Applicants may include those with conditions such as ALS, vocal cord paralysis, laryngeal cancer, autism spectrum disorders, or other conditions that affect speech production.
partnership_eligibility_desc2: Priority will be given to individuals who demonstrate the greatest need and potential benefit from this technology. Our review process ensures that resources are allocated to those who will gain the most significant improvement in their quality of life and communication abilities.
partnership_cta_desc: Ready to get started? Complete our application form to be considered for this groundbreaking program.
voice_cloning_popup_title: Bring your own voice to Cboard ‚Äî powered by ElevenLabs.
voice_cloning_popup_description: Free voice cloning for eligible users with speech impairments. Apply in minutes and use your voice directly in Cboard.
